libs.models.som module¶

class libs.models.som.SOM(X, latent_dim, resolution, sigma_max, sigma_min, tau, init='random', metric='sqeuclidean')[source]¶

Bases: object

Self-Organizing Map (SOM).

SOM is the one of dimensionality reduction method. :param X: Training data. :type X: array-like, shape (number of samples, number of features) :param latent_dim: Number of dimension of latent space. Only support 1 or 2. :type latent_dim: int :param resolution: Number of zeta which is representative points on latent space per one dimension. :type resolution: int :param sigma_max: Maximum value of neighborhood radius, sigma. :type sigma_max: float :param sigma_min: Minimum value of neighborhood radius, sigma. :type sigma_min: float :param tau: Control speed of decreasing sigma, neighborhood rasius. :type tau: int :param init: How to decide init value of latent variable.

If init == 'PCA', it dicided by Principal Component Analysis. If init == 'random', random float values is assigned to latent variables directly. If init == 'random_bmu', random integer values os assigned to array of index of representative points corresponding latent variables. If init is array which have correct shape, it is used to initial value.

Parameters

metric (str) – How to measure data and mapping when latent variables are estimated. metric == 'sqeuclidean' is used if data is numerical vector. metric == 'KLdivergence' is used if data is parameter of categorical distribution. The sum must be 1.0

fit(nb_epoch=100, verbose=True)[source]¶
